author: {'steamid': '76561198274162183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1703536116}
review:
It's very simple but very fun.
As for that one guy who said "aaa gwafix bad", don't listen to him, he clearly doesn't get the point of minimalism.

Imagine this game with a workshop...people would IMMEDIATELY be looking for ways to add Star Wars and Halo ships, or maybe add a sandbox menu so you can put down friendly or enemy ships, or even make their own levels! I think the inclusion of a workshop would be extremely helpful for the game itself, possibly allowing a much more thriving community.

also soundtrack when

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 3143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3143, 'last_played': 1587577014}
review:
Disclaimer: My card idler went a bit crazy on this game and gave me way more hours of logged gameplay than the game is genuinely worth.

This is a space combat/minimalist/neon themed turn based strategy game where you control a fleet of ships and go through scenarios defeating other ships.   While the premise for the game is quite reasonable, the best graphics in the whole game are on the menu screen.   The graphics really are terrible here and detract from pretty much the whole thing.  It's mobile ported, which explains a lot.  Mobile ports simply don't belong on Steam.  This game is one example of hundreds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004188116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1521192767}
review:
I found this game when looking for something with mechanics similiar to the X wing miniatures game.
It is ascetic in presentation and there is not much besides battles. No ship costumization or deployment.
But for a fan of fleet battles it delivers. The difficulty level is good and you will get nice variety of missions and ships.
I will definitely want to see a sequel to this game with better graphics and more depth.
If I didn't convince you to buy this at full price but you still looking for some tactical turn based combat, add the game to wishlist and get it on some sale;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198123729570', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1534433977}
review:
Quote from the game's store page at time of purchase:

We strongly believe in words: 'Pay once, Play forever' and will provide all future content updates for free. 
There are at least two planned expansions with new ships, abilities, campaigns and a multiplayer support.

Those two lines were there when I bought the game. After a LOOOONG time with no information of any kind, the developer showed up, actively promoting a planned sequel, which was to include multiplayer. When asked about this game's multiplayer, which does not yet exist, they took a long time to respond.

When there was a response, it was a very ACTIVE response - there was a sale on the already-low price of the game, an announcement of a major free expansion of game content, andsince then... a paid DLC which seems to directly contradict the promise of "all future conent updates for free". I mean, to be fair, it WAS a $5 game at the time that promise was made, and it's been heavily revamped with a "redux" release now and had the price bumped up a bit.

I previously gave this game a "not recommended" rating, but because of suspicions about the developer failing to deliver on promises, NOT because of the quality of the game. There's still no multiplayer, and the original promise of that as a future update has been - with a well-intended apology - removed from the game's store page. But the "new" product (since it has been significantly overhauled) is worth it for what it promises now.

It takes a little figuring out at first, but once you get it, gameplay flows quite well. Anticipating enemy movements to line up your torpedoes or strafing runs feels satisfying when you get it right. Using abilities at the wrong time, or using the wrong ability for a situation, can lead very quickly to an early grave, but it consistently feels like you got outplayed, not like the game cheated you out of a win. My original review complained about a lack of polish, and while it looks like they may have some issues with the English language in places, the graphics have been cleaned up, the gameplay feels even smoother, and I can much more happily recommend the game.

Also note: The dev did kindly offer me a DLC key, but it doesn't appear to have given me access to the DLC. Additionally, it claimed I already owned the content, so if you're reading this, feel free to try using the code yourself, I think it might be a key for the game instead.
developer_response:
Hello! Even despite your review is negative, I am grateful for it. Feedback is always useful:) Recently we've released a huge update for Star Tactis. There's a lot of new features and content, also overall polishing and improvements. I'd like to ask you to give it a try and edit your review. 

Moreover, there's a DLC with the new game mode. Here's the key for you mate :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198008814677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1488223380}
review:
Doesn´t say Early Access so I guess this is the finished product. Entertains about an hour before it get´s tedious. In that time I have done about 2/3 of the "campaign". The campaign is jsut 30 levels without any story, cutscenes or context. Most of those are won by runnign away and spamming torpedoes while exploiting the AI. Also has some obvious design flaws like havign to reasign every order every turn. Why can´t they just remember the direction and speed I gave them, making me only waste clicks when I want them to change course, not every time?

But it´s cheap and with steams refund policy there is no harm in trying it out. Just don´t expect anything above a nice flashgame.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987292682', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 320, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1528232120}
review:
[h1]Fun mobile game[/h1]

This game is a mobile port, and it shows. Still, I've found it really fun to play, my main regret is that there's no 4X game with simillar combat mechanics. 

[b]Pro[/b]
[list]
[*] Easy to learn, yet tactical.
[*] Graphics are not impressive, yet they work really well. It's like commanding your space army from a radar screen.
[*] Two campaigns, one where you control big fleets, the other one you control fighters.
[*] The ships have inertia, so you have to think where eveything is going to be after the turns end or you won't be able to evade your enemies.
[*] Cheap.
[*] Should run well on old computers.
[/list] 

[b]Cons[/B]
[list]
[*] As many mobile games, it's kind of shallow.
[*] Graphics are non impressive, can get boring fast.
[*] The epic background music gets old fast.
[*] The story and setting are ok, but not very interesting.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198012423340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1519098928}
review:
A 1,000 word review of Star Tactics (2017):

[url=http://awkwardmixture.blogspot.com/2017/01/space-tactics-experiment-in-limited.html]Space Tactics: An Experiment in Limited Design[/url]

A Revised Review (2018):

[url=http://awkwardmixture.blogspot.com/2018/02/a-voyage-into-already-explored-space.html]A Voyage into An Already Explored Space[/url]

In conclusion: Star Tactics Redux is a serious effort to improve on the original game. Most of the major flaws have been dealt with, like the AI, overpowered missiles, game modes, and ships. But though the Steam Store page describes it as “a hardcore turn-based strategy and tactics game full of spacefleet battles” with “30+ hours of gameplay, infinite randomized battles,” and a “huge campaign with different ways of completion.” I would say it's a fast casual game, which probably has about twelve hours max for the base game if one is determined to earn all the three star scores. Sure the DLC will increase, and maybe double, the time, but it's not included in the fifteen dollar price. If one is willing to play skirmish and the DLC more than once, the game could eat up a lot of time.

For what it is, it's certainly an enjoyable little game. And now comes the toughest part. For the first time, I've been asked to review a product. I'm not sure how that's impacted what I've written, or what I'm ultimately going to recommend. I've tried to honestly considered whether I'm being kinder than I would be. After all, I've given harsh reviews over the last two years to Sins of A Solar Empire, Brigador, New 'n' Tasty, Oxenfree, The Vanish of Ethan Carter, Dungeon of the Endless, and XCOM® 2 (lol). Some of these are acclaimed games. Some people may find this as splitting hairs, which pleases no one, but I would recommend Star Tactics Redux, but only for those looking for a simple, fast, casual style game.  Perhaps that's why it's a mobile game as well.
developer_response:

author: {'steamid': '76561198065775506', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1556903241}
review:
If you're looking for the ultimate game to end all other games, this is probably not your game.
If you're looking for you're gonna marry and have kids with, this is probably not your game.
If you're looking for an AAA title with the best graphics of the century, this is definitely not your game.

But if you're looking for a simple but challenging game to have a few hours of fun with, this is it.


Star Tactics takes the mantra "less is more" as its basis and creates great game around it.
It is based on very simple mechanics, but these open up to a quite large amout of tactical decision making, sometimes even feeling similar to chess.
Sure, the graphics are nothing to write home about, but I feel the minimalistic wireframe-like style actually adds to the immersion, making you really feel like a commander directing the battle through his tactical display.
The UI is similarly minimalistic as the grapics and I think it might even be the best part of the game. It's intuitive, clear, and doesn't feel cluttered or complicated at all. While part of this might be due to the simple underlying mechanics, I feel like many bigger game companys could learn one thing or the other from this game.
The levels are quite well designed. Most of the time you're facing a larger opponent fleet, so you actually need to gain an advantage through better positioning and using your ships' abilities well.

While this game is great, I have found four notable flaws.
One, Torpedoes/Rockets are really overpowered. Many battles, you can win through "french-american" tactics: Run away as fast as you can while bombing the hell out of your enemy. If your battleship or dreadnought isn't already in range of the enemy ships, it's a sitting duck.
Two,  sometimes, the enemy AI is dumber than bread. Lay a line of mines, hide behind it and wait for the enemy to run into its doom. Most of the time this is mitigated by being outgunned or outnumbered, though, so it's actually a balanced fight.

Three, the game has no gamemode where you can build your own fleet.
And last: NO MULTIPLAYER. I'd love to play this game against a friend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071097389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482873553}

author: {'steamid': '76561198164727066', 'num_games_owned': 1862, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1482129209}
review:
Star Tactics - хардкорная пошаговая тактическая игра, события которой разворачиваются в космосе, где вы сможете устраивать масштабные космические битвы!

В вашем распоряжении находится целый флот космических кораблей, который поможет вам выиграть в жестокой войне за ресурсы на других планетах.
Вам предстоит управлять сражениями через электронную сенсорную карту (очень похожую на радар), которая позволяет быстро отдавать приказы любому кораблю. Сражения здесь довольно сложные. Враги очень хитрые и умные. Чтобы выходить победителем из каждого сражения вы должны будете придумать собственную оригинальную тактику боя.

Геймплей тут, конечно, очень разнообразен:
В игре присутствуют 2 компании: Основная и Дополнительная (с участием малых космических аппаратов);
Много различных кораблей (начиная от маленьких скаутов и заканчивая огромными дредноутами) с полноценной прокачкой способностей (ракеты, торпеды, щит, форсаж, разворот).

Стоит отметить так же оригинальный графический стиль и качественное атмосферное музыкальное сопровождение (отсылка к X3 and X-Rebirth).
Не забываем так же про наличие достижений Steam и коллекционных карточек.

Star Tactics отлично подойдет для любителей различных тактических симуляторов космических сражений!

review: Star Tactics is a challenging turn-based strategy game. You can control the movement of your ships and you even have to control the movements of your missiles. I would, although, like to see the ability to make custom scenarios. You should be able to control ship placement, which ships you put in, and asteroids. I like the game and I hope that you continue to update it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006602228', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1519254847}
review: A competent turn-based tactics game priced according to its basic production values. The core mechanics of the game are fairly simple, but the central importance of predicting your opponent's next move, imposed by the simultaneous-execution turn system, adds a good amount of nuance. While the game didn't hold my interest in the long term, I got several evenings of entertainment from it, so I am happy with it for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994134708', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1475361774}
review: Every level of the game there is something new and levels are not long so it's not boring to play. I remember I've played Battlefleet Gothic: Armada mostly in tactical view that is why I'm not afraid of that kinda graphics. I bought this game and I don't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089128143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1474152055}
review:
So far so good.

I think it might be a Euro or two too expensive, but the game delivers exactly what it promised - tactical space action with a suprising amount of depth.
Each unit has its own role, derived from its special abilities, health and maneuverability and the game really puts a priority on positioning (firing arcs, cover given by asteroids) and trying to predic enemy movement. Nice brain teaser. It's even improved by AI, which, despite not being perfect (I saw them smash ships into asteroids once or twice) can be quite a challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198266608571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1474128032}
review:
Графика
На первый взгляд может показаться, что игровое пространство пустовато. Но, во-первых, это же космос, чёрт возьми, тут должно быть пусто. А во вторых, графический стиль, который я про себя назвал "радаром", позволяет не отвлекаться на всякую ерунду, а сосредоточиться на бое... 
Геймплей
...Благо, в тактическом плане здесь есть, где развернуться. Не пройдя и трети одного из режимов игры, вы познакомитесь уже с десятком различных типов кораблей, у каждого из которых свои характеристики, способности (ускорение, ракеты, разворот на 180 или 360 градусов, мины и т.д.) и особенности (радиус и направление автоматического огня, количество орудий и т.д.). Соответственно, и действовать приходится, исходя не только из типа имеющихся кораблей, но и из их состава. Также необходимо учитывать комплектацию вражеской армии.
Звук
Чтобы написать про звуки м музыку в игре, пришлось включить её заново. А это означает, что они настолько органично вписались в игру, что на них в хорошем смысле не обращаешь внимания - вы ведь не оцениваете звук своего дыхания.

На долгие осениие и зимние вечера всем рекомендую запасаться пледом, чаем с вкусняшками и этой игрой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054499927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1474124588}
review:
I've cried a river with tears of happiness when I've seen that game first time and was keeping track on that project till it's release. As a huge fan of Steam Birds and Space themed games I dreamed about such tactical turn-based space-themed stuff. What i liked very much is nice AI. I've spent time to pass some levels. First I've thought that it will be piece of cake, but I was wrong. AI is really challenging! That is great! Thank to developers.
Second thing I've liked is visual. Graphisc is really interesting. I imagine myself some space general who is giving orders to the space fleet. Hope to see that game on iPad.
Third thing I liked is diversity of space crafts with different abilities. You can use rockets, power shields, speed boost, etc.

Thank you, developers, for such interesing game. I gotta go and play it a little more :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197992299164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1480016776}
review:
Star Tactics is an interesting turn-based strategy, which do not immediately disclose its advantages, and at first glance can not satisfy every player. However, as time flows it engaged me more and more. 
From the gameplay, I noted several advantages: 
+ Variety of spaceships 
+ Various game modes 
+ Game mechanics are simple and clear 
+ Complexity increases with each level 
+ Pleasing to the eye yet simple graphics 
+ Interesting achievements, obtaining is a challenge 
+ Trading Cards 

As a result, we have an excellent strategy about space battles that provides a 'one more tun and go to bed' syndrome. 
I hope the game will receive the network mode in the future , in which you can test your skills obtained in the single player. 
The game is definitely worth considering, I will definitely stay tuned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025920982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1473710121}
review:
I write reviews very rarely. But this game impressed me: 
Simple gameplay, but at the same time it is necessary to think for a couple of turns ahead, the number of techniques and a variety of set-ups in each level pleases. 
I decided to play at work on my old notebook, because I saw low technical requirements - I am not disappointed. I'd love to see the product on the mobile platforms. 
Though AI is challenging enough, I would like to see online battles in the future. 
In general, the game is completely worth the investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071536115', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1473884992}
review: Это не стратегия и не совсем тактика. Это очень кайфовая головоломка. Интересный сеттинг, затягивающие миссии. Что еще надо для приятного вечера?

author: {'steamid': '76561198037738622', 'num_games_owned': 574, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1473717559}
review: Neat small game with suitable visuals and robust gameplay. Don't expect hardcore tactic wargame though. Not a bad choice considering low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008279269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1473810999}
review:
Never fond of turn-based strategy games. But found this game is a good one.. Interesting design. As for me, this is a very important part of the strategy. Simple selection of sides, as green and red is simply to distinguish, not bothers Player with unnecessary (in my opinion) factors. Special abilities for each unit. Each unit has its own ... I'd say feature. Depending on how well you use it, your fleet will succeed or not. Each side has its own strengths and weaknesses, and this feature gradually reveals as you progress through the game.Thus we have a really elegant strategy, which is interesting, and most importantly not boring to play. Each battle brings only pleasure. If you're looking for a game for excellent value for the money and to spent hours of gameplay on, Star Tactics is your choice.
PS In the end I want to add that the game would look gorgeous on my phone, to hang in a game of this type on small screens is a pleasure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039441626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1497272462}
review:
Cool game!

Interesting gameplay and implementation of fights. During the battle, you have to think about every move before you go on the attack, otherwise you are waiting for a defeat. Each ship has its own special feature, which is sometimes a must.
Very often the power of your and enemy fleets are not equal, that's why gameplay is captivating and challenging. Every time you really want to bring victory to your fleet..
The game has a pleasant and friendly controls, just in case there is a tutorial at the beginning of the first level, which will help you to make a first victory in the vastness of space.
Different and interesting levels and "quick battle" in the game will not make you bored.

I look forward to new updates from the developers. And of course the mobile release!

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016048418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1473600449}
review:
A great game so far. Easy to learn. But have a deep strategic gameplay. And i very like graphic style, nothing bother, you will see only main things.

Get it and you will like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236477590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1473587074}
review: Отличная игра. Необычная боёвка, и битвы. Радует, что кроме компании, есть режим быстрых матчей. По началу было не понятно, что и как. Без обучения сразу ворвался в скирмич. Дошел до 13-го матча. Дальше для меня показалось сложно. Раз пять переигрывал. Использование брони, ускорителей, оружия - меня не спасало. Для ценителей RTS про космос с миксом пошаговыых боев! Рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050551102', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1473604518}
review:
Simple looking at start, yet veeeery catchy inside. No excessive parts, only your tactic skills matters. Hardcore as it is, reminds me about good old days with NES. 
Best space tactic puzzle i've played in a pretty while!

The only downside i see so far: lack of 'Options' menu with the 'Turn off that damn music' switch in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998348465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1473713770}
review:
The quickest and easiest way to describe Star Tactics is this: imagine taking Steambirds (an old Flash-turned-mobile game involving an air war during a Steampunk timeline) and changing the setting to outer space with starships.

Instead of airships, you have capital ships; instead of propeller-driven or jet-powered aircraft, you have space fighters, etc.

That's pretty much it. Even the control scheme (where you guide your units using arrows) and special abilities (such as a defensive shield or a 180 degree turn) are nearly identical to Steambirds. 

After requesting an options menu be implemented, the developer readily responded and added one. The options menu now lets you set music and sound effects, as well as resolution, advanced effects, and gives you the choice to play in windowed mode.

Despite my harsh comparison to Steambirds, the fact remains that Star Tactics is an entertaining, albeit somewhat simple, game. It's not meant for people to spend all day playing, but for those who have limited time and want to play a game in short spurts.

Overall, I'd recommend Star Tactics, so long as you realize you're getting a relatively simple strategy game. There's nothing wrong with that at all, but just be aware of that before purchasing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989074294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1473414849}
review: The game has got potential, its fun, the ai is challenging. However it still needs a bit more. With extra time this could be a game i would frequently play. Looking forward to more content updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120618698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1529053600}
review:
I definitely recommend this game! It of one of the few really good old school strategies that needs you to think. It's deep, addictive and well balanced. This game isn't a walk in the park, it challenged me well, but there was no frustration, just skill and tactics. 
EDIT: Thax for options hot fix. Its good when developers react on Players feedback that fast!

/I believe it would be release on mobile too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198169778814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1473295018}
review:
Do you like Space Rangers or Star Wolves or some tactical games like this? 
Believe me this is CASUAL "Space Rangers" with turn-based tactics!

Pros:
Graphics and level disign are simple and beautiful and very well designed.
But UI like on mobile and definatly too big! This is a simple tactical game
but gameplay not so typical for turn-based games.
But is impressively intuitive. 

Cons:
The most obvious first: It's not finished.
I guess developers add some features on first DLC.
Honestly, I don't think a tutorial is really necessary, 
but I for one will be happy to see the campaign mode more detailed.

I recomend to add it to your wishlist and buy on steam sale.
